description: Unique system-generated identifier for the status record.
System timestamp of creation or last update for the record (format likely YYYYMMDDHHMMSSmmm; trailing spaces observed).
Indicates this is the default status assigned to new work orders.
Display label of the work order status used in screens and reports.
Numeric sort order controlling where this status appears and/or the progression sequence in workflows.
Generalized status category used to drive business rules and reporting.
Identifier from a legacy system used for migration mapping; confirm origin.
Legacy source table name associated with this status for migration/audit purposes; confirm origin.
UI color associated with this status for visual cues (e.g., hex/RGB); confirm format.
Flag marking the status as inactive so it cannot be selected.
Allows editing of work orders while they are in this status.
Prompts users to save changes when applying this status; confirm exact behavior.
Indicates that assets linked to work orders in this status are considered out of service.
Identifier of the default sub-status linked to this status (0 typically means none); confirm mapping.
Likely reference to a related default sub-status record; purpose unclearâ€”confirm with SME.
